title: Reframing Problems
description: Look at problems from different angles and brainstorm creative solutions.
example: What if we couldn’t use words to explain this?
activity: Reverse the problem: 'How would you make the problem worse?' Then brainstorm solutions to fix it.

title: What-If Scenarios
description: Imagine hypothetical scenarios to spark creativity.
example: What if gravity worked in reverse?
activity: Explain how the world would function in such situations.

title: Breaking Rules Creatively
description: Challenge conventional rules and suggest alternatives.
example: Why do books have pages? What if they didn’t?
activity: Think about why rules exist and how breaking them might lead to innovation.

title: Mystery Box Challenge
description: Use random items to solve a challenge or tell a story.
example: Combine items from a box to invent a new tool or story.
activity: Fill a box with random items and have participants use them to solve a problem.

title: Divergent Thinking
description: Generate multiple solutions instead of finding the 'right' answer.
example: How many uses can you think of for a paperclip?
activity: Focus on quantity over quality in brainstorming sessions.

title: Role Reversal
description: Pretend to be someone else to view the problem differently.
example: What would a bird do in this situation?
activity: Solve a problem from another person's or character’s perspective.

title: Design a World
description: Create your own imaginary world with unique rules.
example: What if there were no cars in your city?
activity: Design a world where one rule is completely different.

title: Unusual Combinations
description: Combine unrelated objects to create something new.
example: What happens when you mix a piano with a bicycle?
activity: Invent something that blends two unrelated things.

title: Wordless Storytelling
description: Tell a story without using words.
example: How can you show emotions using only emojis?
activity: Create a visual-only story using pictures or objects.

title: What’s Missing?
description: Find and fix a gap in an everyday situation.
example: What could improve a typical school day?
activity: List things that could be added or changed to make something better.

title: Thinking Backward
description: Start with the goal and work backward to find solutions.
example: If you wanted to invent flying shoes, what problems would you solve first?
activity: Reverse-engineer a solution from the outcome.

title: Build a Bridge
description: Connect two unrelated ideas or concepts.
example: How is a tree like a computer?
activity: Find similarities between unrelated objects.

title: Picture Puzzle
description: Solve problems using only visual clues.
example: What’s happening in this picture?
activity: Create or interpret stories based on abstract drawings.

title: Invent a Holiday
description: Design a new holiday with unique traditions.
example: What would the theme of your holiday be?
activity: Plan decorations, activities, and customs for your invented holiday.

title: Dream Big
description: Imagine achieving something impossible.
example: What if you could live underwater?
activity: Brainstorm how you could make the impossible possible.

title: Shape Challenge
description: Turn a random shape into something meaningful.
example: Draw something starting with this abstract shape.
activity: Give participants a shape and ask them to transform it into something else.

title: Collaborative Creation
description: Work with others to build something amazing.
example: What can you create if everyone adds one idea?
activity: Create a story, structure, or project with each person contributing one part.

title: Impossible Inventions
description: Invent something that seems ridiculous.
example: What if you could invent a machine to talk to animals?
activity: Draw or explain a fantastical invention.

title: Time Traveler’s Guide
description: Think about life in a different time.
example: How would people solve problems 100 years ago?
activity: Write about what life would be like in the past or future.

title: Superpower Problems
description: Use superpowers to solve everyday problems.
example: What if you could stop time?
activity: Brainstorm how you’d use a superpower to solve challenges.
